column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref

#Text=This invention relates to a method and apparatus for the delivery, or placement, of, for example, a voice prosthesis device into a puncture provided in the tracheoesophageal wall of a speech restoration patient.

#Text=A speech restoration technique is known wherein air from the trachea is diverted from its normal flow path out through the tracheostoma to a flow path through a voice prosthesis providing a more or less permanent passageway to the esophagus.
#Text=Esophageal speech results.
#Text=See U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=Voice prostheses currently in use for providing controlled air pathways through tracheoesophageal punctures incorporate flexible retention collars.
#Text=The retention collar lies against the esophageal surface of the tracheoesophageal wall to reduce the likelihood of dislodgement of the prosthesis from the puncture.

#Text=While this configuration substantially improves retention, the presence of the large retention collar makes insertion of a prosthesis more difficult and traumatic to the tissue surrounding the tracheoesophageal puncture.
#Text=A possibility inherent in difficult or traumatic prosthesis insertion is incomplete insertion.
#Text=Incomplete insertion may result in aspiration of the prosthesis into the airway.
#Text=The prosthesis may be expelled by coughing, requiring endoscopic retrieval from the airway.
#Text=Additionally, concern about prosthesis insertion difficulty may prevent some patients and physicians from employing this method of voice restoration.
#Text=According to an aspect of the invention, a device is provided for insertion into a first opening in a human body.
#Text=The device includes a device body having a longitudinal axis and a flexible first flange provided on an outside surface of the device body.

#Text=The first flange has a deployed, use orientation in which it projects generally outwardly from the outside surface of the device body and an undeployed, insertion orientation in which it is resiliently deflected toward the device body.
#Text=A retainer retains the flange in its insertion orientation.
#Text=The retainer is constructed of a material soluble in a fluid.

#Text=According to another aspect of the invention, a method is provided for inserting into a first opening in a human body a device including a device body having a longitudinal axis and a flexible first flange provided on an outside surface of the device body.
#Text=The first flange has a deployed, use orientation in which it projects generally outwardly from the outside surface of the device body.

#Text=The method comprises the steps of resiliently deflecting the flange toward the device body, placing over the resiliently deflected flange a retainer of a material soluble in a fluid, and inserting the device into the first opening.
